name: Entertainment Things I'd Like To See Quiz | Entertainment | 10 Questions

questions.text: If Jack LEMMON starred as Harry LIME, what movie would be involved?
questions.explanation:
The Third Man.

	The Orson Welles movie also starred Joseph Cotten.

questions.text: If John Amos and Gary Sandy teamed up for a TV series, the show could be called "Amos and Sandy". Which series did NOT feature one of them in a regular or semi-regular role?
questions.explanation:
One Day At A Time.

	Amos was the weatherman on MTM and the husband on "Good Times". Sandy worked at WKRP.

questions.text: If Paul Fix starred in a TV show that previewed the season's new TV series, it could be called "Paul Fix With The Fall Picks". In what TV series did Fix appear as a regular?
questions.explanation:
The Rifleman.

	He played Sheriff Micah Torrance in the western that starred Chuck Connors. "Rebel" was Nick Adams, "Lawman" was John Russell, "Texan" was Rory Calhoun.

questions.text: Paul Fix often appeared in movies with what star?
questions.explanation:
John Wayne.

	Fix was a frequent co-star with Wayne in westerns (such as "Red River", "Tall in the Saddle", "Stagecoach", etc.)

questions.text: How about a show starring Joe Flynn (of "McHale's Navy") called "The Mighty Flynn"? Actually, Flynn later co-starred in another series with one of his McHale co-stars. Which actor was his co-star?
questions.explanation:
Tim Conway.

	Flynn and Conway starred in a sitcom called "The Tim Conway Show". It didn't make it. Flynn, a good actor, died young.

questions.text: An episode of the original 'Star Trek' series could have been titled "The Day of the Jack Gill". (Actually, the character's name was John Gill - a good guy gone haywire in a nazi society.) Who played the character?
questions.explanation:
David Brian.

	Brian played the slightly out-of-it John Gill.

questions.text: The actor who appeared as Nazi leader John Gill in an episode of "Star Trek" also starred in what old-time TV series?
questions.explanation:
Mr. District Attorney

	Broderick Crawford was in "Highway Patrol", George Maharis was in "Route 66" (with Martin Milner), Richard Crenna was in "Real McCoys" (with Walter Brennan).

questions.text: How about a show called "Redd, White and Blue"? "Redd" could be Redd Foxx and "White" could be Betty White. What TV series had a character named "Blue"?
questions.explanation:
The High Chaparral.

	Blue was the young character (teens or twenties) in "High Chaparral".

questions.text: "Blue" was a character in a TV series.  Who did NOT also appear in the cast of that series with him?
questions.explanation:
Phyllis Kirk.

	Erickson played the father and head of the ranch. Mitchell played his brother (and Blue's uncle). Cristal played Leif's second wife. Kirk was in the TV series "Thin Man".

questions.text: In a curious quirk, David Birney played a guy named Bernie in a TV series. Who was his co-star?
questions.explanation:
Meredith Baxter.

	The two starred in "Bridget Loves Bernie". Davis was in "Love That Bob" (before "Brady Bunch"). DeCamp was also in "Love That Bob". Beer was in "77 Sunset Strip".
